articles_1.title: EPA Grants West Virginia Authority to Oversee Carbon Capture, Fourth State to Gain Approval
articles_1.summary: The EPA has granted West Virginia primary enforcement authority ('primacy') to oversee carbon capture projects and permit Class VI wells, making it the fourth state after North Dakota, Wyoming, and Louisiana to receive such authority. The move aims to expedite approval processes for carbon sequestration projects, particularly significant given the IRA's $85 per metric ton tax credit for CO2 storage and growing state interest in carbon capture technology.
